news.title: Mexico's Antitrust Authority Won't Penalize Amazon and Mercado Libre
news.body: Mexico's Cofece has decided not to enforce corrective measures against Amazon and Mercado Libre, despite acknowledging their creation of competitive barriers in the eCommerce market. This decision, affecting two companies with an 85% market share, underscores the challenges of applying traditional antitrust laws in the digital economy.

news.title: Apple's iPhone Air Launch in China Delayed by Regulatory Issues
news.body: Apple has postponed the launch of its iPhone Air in China due to pending regulatory approvals for its eSIM technology. This delay highlights the complexities of navigating regulatory landscapes in crucial markets, potentially affecting Apple's market timing and competitive edge in the region.

news.title: FTC Probes Amazon and Google's Ad Transparency
news.body: The FTC is investigating Amazon and Google for potential opacity in their advertising practices. This scrutiny could lead to major shifts in how these tech behemoths disclose ad terms and pricing, directly impacting their advertising revenue streams.

news.title: GENIUS Act Establishes Federal Stablecoin Regulations
news.body: The U.S. has enacted the GENIUS Act, creating a federal regulatory framework for stablecoins. This landmark legislation is set to foster greater innovation and adoption in the stablecoin sector, influencing both the banking and retail industries.

news.title: Bank of England Forms New Retail Payments Board with Industry Leaders
news.body: The Bank of England is enhancing its payment systems by forming a new Retail Payments Infrastructure Board with leaders from banks, fintechs, and merchants. This move aims to leverage fintech innovations to advance the UK's financial landscape, reflecting the sector's evolving dynamics.
